This reaver of the cold marsh is not just a monster; he is a force of nature. Where there is peace and prosperity in the world, Grendel strikes, eager to prove that tranquility is transitory and death is the only constant. He stalks the edge of his fens, seeking settlements where joy holds sway. He strikes under cover of night, primarily targeting celebrations or festivals. The more happiness or joy he can extinguish, the better. Although Grendel is a unique creature, killing him won't save the world from his ravages for long. Once Grendel's mother instinctively feels the pain of her violent son's death, she soon births a replacement. The new Grendel seems to avoid the sites his elder brothers terrorized, as if he instinctively knows that such a place hosts heroes powerful enough to defeat him. **[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14)): DC 49 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 47 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 44 [Grendel](/Monsters.aspx?ID=690) **Source** [Bestiary 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=32) pg. 136 2.0 **Perception** +35; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), keen hearing 120 feet **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +34, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +39, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +34, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +34, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +33 **Str** +10 **Dex** +5 **Con** +7 **Int** +0 **Wis** +6 **Cha** +5 **Keen Hearing** Grendel's hearing is a precise sense to a range of 120 feet. --- **AC** 44 **Fort** +36 **Ref** +32 **Will** +31 **HP** 360 **Resistances** all 15 (except unarmed attacks) **[Frightful Presence](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=17)** (aura, emotion, fear, mental) 60 feet, DC 38.
**[Attack of Opportunity](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=3)** Grendel gains an extra reaction at the start of each of his turns that he can use only to make an Attack of Opportunity with his claw. He can't use more than one Attack of Opportunity triggered by the same action.
**[Ferocity](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=16)
**Unstoppable **Trigger** Grendel would take [persistent damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) or gain one of the following conditions: [blinded](/Conditions.aspx?ID=1), [clumsy](/Conditions.aspx?ID=3), [confused](/Conditions.aspx?ID=5), [controlled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=6), [dazzled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=7), [deafened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=8), [doomed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=9), [drained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=10), [enfeebled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=13), [fascinated](/Conditions.aspx?ID=14), [fatigued](/Conditions.aspx?ID=15), [fleeing](/Conditions.aspx?ID=17), [frightened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=19), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [petrified](/Conditions.aspx?ID=30), [sickened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34), [slowed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=35), [stunned](/Conditions.aspx?ID=36), or [stupefied](/Conditions.aspx?ID=37); **Effect** The persistent damage or condition from the triggering effect doesn't affect Grendel. --- **Speed** 40 feet **Melee** fist +37 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 4d8+18 bludgeoning plus [Improved Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=27) **Melee** jaws +37 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192), [versatile B](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)), **Damage** 4d10+18 piercing **Ranged** rock +37 ([Brutal](/Traits.aspx?ID=249), [range increment 150 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)), **Damage** 2d12+18 bludgeoning **Hands of the Murderer** Grendel's fist Strikes deal 18 bludgeoning damage on a failure (but no damage on a critical failure). **Tooth Grind** **Requirements** Grendel is grabbing a creature; **Effect** Grendel makes a bludgeoning jaws Strike against the creature he's grabbing. On a hit, the creature also takes 2d6 [persistent bleed damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) and becomes [wounded 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=42), or increases its wounded value by 1 if already wounded. On a critical hit, the creature instead becomes wounded 2, or increases its wounded value by 2 if already wounded. If a creature dies from Tooth Grind, Grendel regains 40 HP; this is a [healing](/Traits.aspx?ID=89) effect. **[Throw Rock](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=38)**
Grendel's Mother At the bottom of a remote mountain lake filled with sea serpents is a magical house—the lair of Grendel's mother. Among her many treasures is a sword so big and heavy that only a supernaturally strong individual can wield it. When Grendel is injured, he retreats here to heal.
name: Grendel
